means: 可能力，（用复数）潜能，潜力。可能性

sentence.Network_en: All of these are quite useful breeds whose potentiality has not been realised.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有这些都是十分有用的品种，其潜力还没有被完全发挥。

sentence.Network_en: For motion is nothing else than the reduction of something from potentiality to actuality.
sentence.Network_cn: 运动只是将事物的潜在性变为现实性而已.

sentence.Network_en: Develop effective learning and potentiality of E century children.
sentence.Network_cn: 培养有效学习,发展潜能的e代儿童.

新东方六级高频词汇整理_百度文库 ... persistent a. 坚持不懈的 potential a. 可能的，潜在的 prevalent a. 普遍的，流行的.

entry.def: If something has potentialities or potentiality, it is capable of being used or developed in particular ways.

example.ex: The breathtaking potentialities of mechanization set the minds of manufacturers and merchants on fire...
example.tran: 机械化的惊人潜力使制造厂和商人们激动不已。

example.ex: All of these are quite useful breeds whose potentiality has not been realised.
example.tran: 所有这些都是十分有用的品种，其潜力还没有被完全发挥。

means.word_mean: 1. the inherent capacity for coming into being
2. an aptitude that may be developed

auth_sentence.content: Characteristics before only foreshadowed, or existing only in potentiality.

auth_sentence.content: This distant potentiality hides the more immediate urgencies which are considerably more certain.
